Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery amphora; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of woman to right (lower body with dots in added red on garment and added white on right foot, left hand, and garment remaining); black band, probably edge of panel, on the right; below, two dilute bands.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 250-1, no. B149)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0072) (Phase 1)
